channel.title: Blog on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Building an Image Similarity Model with Keras: My Bellsprout Moment
item.description: Introduction In this project, I set out to explore image similarity using deep learning. Leveraging the power of Keras, I aimed to detect similarities between images using a Pokémon image dataset from Kaggle. The idea was simple: take a pre-trained ResNet50 model, process Pokémon images into their vector forms, and then compare these vectors with an image of myself. The results? You’ll see soon enough. The Dataset and Approach For this project, I used a Pokémon images dataset available on Kaggle.

item.title: Machine Learning using SQL?
item.description: “The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.” — Lao Tzu Yes, you read that one right! One of the most fundamental machine learning algorithms out there is Linear Regression. In simple words, it is a technique to describe a relationship between a response(a.k.a dependent) variable and one or more explanatory (a.k.a independent) variable(s). After doing some reading into the “math” behind these algorithms, I realized that this can be easily achieved in SQL.
